physical.notes: A 1921 incident of chaining to benches and strapping leaving marks, referred to in a nurse=s report, led to instructions from the Indian Commissioner and from the Deputy Superintendent General that these forms of punishment would not be tolerated by the government and should be ended. The government intended to issue a circular on acceptable forms of punishment.
